Key Match Events: Cody Gakpo’s equaliser for Netherlands against Poland took heavy deflections on its way in.
Erik Janza’s equaliser for Slovenia against Denmark took heavy deflections on its way in.
Kerem Akturkoglu’s clinching goal in Turkey’s thrilling 3-1 win against Georgia in the 97th minute was into an empty net after the goalkeeper went up to try to score an equaliser.
Two of Germany’s goals in the 5-1 win over Scotland were struck from outside the box, but also were from within the ‘D’, from 19 and 22 yards respectively.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Euro 2024 ball is not a major outlier from other balls of the current era, although it appears fast through the air.
The long-range strikes have not, by and large, been absolutely thumped in, flying along in a straight line. They have instead curled or bent towards the goal astutely.

Nicolae Stanciu’s goal for Romania came from a ball laid back to him. He used the spin on the ball in his favour, getting under and around it and sending it curling away from the goalkeeper into the far corner.
Arda Guler’s stunner against Georgia came from a broadly similar technique — albeit left-footed — but he was getting around the ball to start it outside the post and bring the shot into the goal.
Others: The trend of long-range Euro 2024 goals owes to good technique – and a good ball.
The article discusses the trend of long-range goals in Euro 2024 and attributes it to good technique and the quality of the ball.
The article mentions that the Euro 2024 ball is not a major outlier from other balls of the current era, although it appears fast through the air.
